text: hanks for your question on healthcare magic.i can understand your concern. possibility of post infectious bronchitis is more likely. bronchitis (inflammation of airways) is common after pneumonia.and persistent dry cough and chest pain are mostly due to bronchitis.so better to consult pulmonologist and get done clinical examination of respiratory system and pft (pulmonary function test).pft will not only diagnose bronchitis but it will also tell you about severity of the disease and treatment is based on severity only. you will mostly improve with inhaled bronchodilators (formoterol or salmeterol) and inhaled corticosteroid (ics) (budesonide or fluticasone).don't worry, you will be alright with all these. hope i have solved your query. i will be happy to help you further. wish you good health. thanks.
